website_summaries.verdict: Entry-level pressure washer for basic tasks.
pros: Compact design with quick connect nozzles
Includes soap dispenser and attachable detergent bottle

customer_reviews.title: indicating that this is pretty common. When we got the replacement nozzle it ...
customer_reviews.text: It didn't initially work when using fine-spray nozzle. It would just cut off. We called and they implored us not to return the whole unit, and instead they would send us a replacement nozzle, indicating that this is pretty common. When we got the replacement nozzle it worked fine. I am happy now, but if this problem is as common as it seems, they should try to improve the initial product quality.
customer_reviews.author: GreggTex

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great pressure washer. Very long cord with a circuit protector on the end. Hose is great quality. Comes with a soap container attachment. Has great pressure and cleaned my patio in only an hour. Just awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Swan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use is powerful enough and does not destroy ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use is powerful enough and does not destroy wood. I am older and it is not heavy or hard to move around the decks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: well...it started out great!!....and I posted a 5 start review....... BUT ...only after about 10 uses it is now broke. SEE PICS!!
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Better than we bargained for!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this little cleaner for a number of projects we had. After a friend's gas powered sprayer would not work we figured this would be better than renting one. It has turned out to be a wonderful addition to our cleaning power tools. It's lightweight has plenty of power spray even at the lowest setting its compact electric and folds away into a box for safe storage. We absolutely love it
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Motor Blew, But Machine Was Promptly Replaced
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this five stars because of the experience of buying Greenworks. After assembling the pressure washer as directed, I turned it on. It made a short sound then died completely. All troubleshooting pointed to the motor having shorted out, but since one cannot get to the motor, it's just a guess. I complained directly to Greenworks. The model had been discontinued, but within a couple of days, they sent me a replacement machine. It's bigger and heavier than I would have chosen, but it works well and I cannot say enough good about Greenworks customer service.
customer_reviews.author: notjustmary

customer_reviews.title: Beware: total garbage design and materials selection
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage. Like other reviews mention, the attachment of the hose to the washer body is poorly designed and is aluminum. Cross threaded the second time I used it and no longer can attach the hose. It's difficult to even get it started to screw on and then, since it's aluminum which is soft, it cross threads and then becomes useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Haggerty

customer_reviews.title: I like the pressure washer but the pressure hose is either ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the pressure washer but the pressure hose is either stripped or wrong size and does not fit. I contacted the manufacturer and they will not honor their warranty nor the extended warranty that I purchase. I had to purchase another pressure washer hose from another manufacturer. Very poor customer service and for that reason I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby L Burgess

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed and upset with this product
customer_reviews.text: July, 2018, To say the least, I am very, very disappointed and upset with this product. My ordinary garden hose with nozzle has much more powerful water flow than what I received from the pressure washer. Perhaps this is a fluke, but it is a fluke at my expense.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for the first use
customer_reviews.text: Used it for about 3 hrs. Tried to use it the next day and it would not start. I left an email on the Greenworks site and explained the issue and was told it did not meet their criteria and did not get a response back. It worked great for the first use??
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Hose Connection Leaks
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this pressure washer the hose connection leaked. I would not recommend buying this product!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpack

customer_reviews.title: Great priced device
customer_reviews.text: Excellent washer. It really does its job, was bit sceptic but after using it strongly recommend this device
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last cheap
customer_reviews.text: Warning do not buy this product mine lasted one year six months, with light use just for car washing. I called the company to ask about it she said there’s nothing they can do its out of warranty. I told the tech-support person that I won’t be buying any green works products and she said that’s fine what kind of customer service is that.
customer_reviews.author: joseph tesoro

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level washer -- no need to spend lots of money on one. I bought this to wash the cars and it does the job perfectly. Product is good quality and gives zero leaks. This is easy to use and should last a long time. If you are looking for something very powerful then you will need a gas powered washer. But for washing cars or lawn furniture, this will do the job. It's easy to find accessories for this machine because it uses 1/4" quick disconnect. Other machines have a different connection so it's hard to find accessories. I can happily recommend this product since I enjoy using this machine.
customer_reviews.author: alexg

customer_reviews.title: Get the upgraded version
customer_reviews.text: I got this to pressure wash my porch and drive way. I should've gotten one of the larger ones. While it did the job, I had to hold the wand no more than a few inches away from the brick in order for it to remove all of the grime as it should. Do not purchase this if you are looking to pressure wash large areas quickly, houses, large vehicles, etc. Spend the extra money and get the upgraded versions.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Broken handle
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this as a Christmas gift for my dad and to my embarrassment, when he opened the package, the handle was broken. Ordered a replacement and again, same problem. Handle was broken twice. I was no longer offer to receive a replacement and we are without a pressure washer. Really really disappointed. We were looking forward to using this at home instead of taking the cars to wash every week.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan de Leon

customer_reviews.title: I like this machine a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this machine a lot. So far, I've washed my car three times...works great. The soap gun is not too par but l bought the Dusichin SFL-001. Works great now. ( Thank you Chrisfix!) I washed away some stains and mold from my side walk. It did a good job, I didn't think it could handle such a feat but it did. Would of given 5 star but deducted 1 star for the lousy soap gun. Watch 'Chrisfix' videos on youtube for great ideas on how to Super Clean Your Car.
customer_reviews.author: José Cota

customer_reviews.title: Leaks internally
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job for a small powerwasher except that is leaks internally very badly. If the manufacturer want to provide me with the plumbing parts that needs to be replaced I'll do it myself however it leaked like this from the first day so it is a problem!
customer_reviews.author: TeacherMac

customer_reviews.title: I could spit better
customer_reviews.text: This power washer worked very well for the first 4 months and now it spits, powers up for a few seconds then just spits again. Wanted it to clean my dirty deck before November. No way can I get it to work, very disappointed in it.. Would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year with the sole purpose of washing my car. It worked great for my weekly car wash. After I plasti dipped my car, I changed to a bi-weekly wash. It was pretty solid until last week when it just completely crapped out. I plugged it and and got non stop buzzing. I hit the reset button and it just kept buzzing. The buzzing finally stopped only because the cable isn't working anymore. I need to see if I can locate a manufacturer's warranty. Until its fixed, my review stands as is
customer_reviews.author: MMastro28

customer_reviews.title: Bought Sept 2016. Used it twice last summer worked ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought Sept 2016. Used it twice last summer worked okay. Took out of the shed today to find zero pressure, front hose cross threaded. For $129, I don't expect a professional quality machine but 2 (light) uses in under 2yrs before it breaks is ridiculous. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Askjok

customer_reviews.title: Compact, easy-to-use household pressure washer that works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the 1st time yesterday. Washed a 40' x 12' back deck and rails, a 10' x 12' front porch (both PT wood), plus 3 sides of a manufactured home and gutters. It performed flawlessly. Older reviews complained about weak hose connections, but they apparently solved that problem since the connectors on mine are sturdy brass. Even with everything hooked up (water hose, power cord), I was able to move it around easily. The wand is a nice size, not too big not too small. The hose reel helps keep everything wrapped up for storage, and the whole thing doesn't take up much space in my garden shed. Very happy with this sprayer!
customer_reviews.author: Ken I.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used & broken
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t tried it yet. It came damaged with a broken handle. Looks used with limescale buildup on hose connection and water in the hose. Had to clean off connection and use oil to screw in the wand hose passed the lime buildup.
customer_reviews.author: Travis & Marisa Tramp

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming power; limited soap action; overwhelming noise.
customer_reviews.text: Underwhelming power; limited soap action; overwhelming noise. It's really not worth it to me. I have tried several NON-powered items here on Amazon and find that the two that I bought and kept are sufficiently close in power, and a sliver of the price, to warrant returning this item. I'm glad if it works for others, but it disappoints here.
customer_reviews.author: The Family

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more money and get a better quality pressure washer
customer_reviews.text: The hose inside the pressure washer that feeds the water has burst. I had to take it apart and replace the hose inside. It burst again. Very frustrating. Spend a little more money and get a better quality pressure washer. Briggs & Stratton make a really nice electric pressure washer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is it durable?
customer_reviews.text: Bot late Feb 2017. Used about half a dozen times. Design: Love the hose reel storage. Good nozzle choices. Easy to use and attach hose. BIG QUESTION ABOUT DURABILITY. Was using Jan. 2018 (warm Houston). Mid "session" (stopped using it for a few minutes and attempted to use again), pump failed. Called Greenworks and they will be sending me a new one. Caveats: One year warranty. The "new" washers warranty does not extend past the original washers warranty date. Summary: Design/ease of use: 4/5 Customer Service: 5/5 Durability: TBD
customer_reviews.author: HandyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good Versatile Unit
customer_reviews.text: I am over 70 and was looking for a light duty, light weight, small job, power washer for cleaning the car, exterior windows, the patio and our siding. I did not want the headache or maintenance of storing a large gasoline powered washer and it's fuel ..... been there and done that! This unit so far has filled the bill perfectly. It is light weight, easy to assemble and operate and has sufficient power and is ideal for small jobs. Its not for large jobs but for my needs, and maybe yours, it is was well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: JFSSR

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Jet spray handle uses a long insert for pressure. That handle is improperly made on both the same units I bought. Both are defective water leaks out trigger handle. Impossible to use. No blast no pressure poorly made! Unable to secure long pressure unit into handle. Soooo disappointed!!! I thought it was a missing part. No it’s tooled wrong in manufacturing. Handle won’t attach to sprayer. Not a purchasable plastic or metal connection to fix it. It’s in manufacturing of the handle unit made with screws. Plus they both leak in same place. Not sellable seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon W.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I thought I was going to love this little pressure washer however just like many other my machine worked well for the first few times using it and then smoked and stopped working. I too only used it about 3 times and had it for 1 year and 5 months. The warranty is only 1 year!
customer_reviews.author: DONNA

customer_reviews.title: plastic Junk
customer_reviews.text: Stay Away! Plastic piece of junk. Used 4 to 5 times over 14 months and it died right after 12 month warranty. Most connections and parts eorn out in 4 to 5 uses. There is reason it has terrible warranty!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This lasted about 10 washes and the pump broke. I own a mobile detailing business and this was a HUGE mistake on my end. DO NOT BUY WASTE OF MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mehh...
customer_reviews.text: We needed a pressure washer to clean the outside of our cabin... this one took 3 times as long as our (now) gas powered one. We had to get extremely close to the wood and run over the same spot several times to get the affect we were looking for. If you're wanting something that you can clean you car with or outside playground equipment, etc - this will get he job done. If you want to clean you deck, strip stain/paint/etc then you'll need a MUCH more powerful unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Brown

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY! Broke upon 1st use.
customer_reviews.text: Broke my first use. Followed the instructions perfectly. Something broke internally which caused it to lose all pressure. I missed the return window by a day, as I didn't use it right away when it arrived. Dont buy.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Pressure? Washer?
customer_reviews.text: Soap bottle attachment is basically useless. There's pretty much no pressure with the soap bottle attachment on. It'd be quicker, and you'd use less soap just dumping buckets if soap water on whatever you're cleaning. Not sure what pressure the pump adds if any. To test this I grabbed a couple of adapters and just hooked the hose and spray wand directly to my garden hose. I got the same amount if pressure, maybe a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Glave

customer_reviews.title: When coupled with simply green, it really cleans siding well.
customer_reviews.text: So far this little guy has not disappointed. I have used power washers I borrowed from friends in the past, only to spend all day doing it. The north side of my house gets green gook so badly there is no way to get rid of it other than power washing. I did get smart this year however, and I pretreated with simply green. This little guy has enough power to clean my siding in a remarkably fast manner. I just wish there was a longer cord, I just can't seem to reach the other end of my house. It has enough pressure, it is light enough, and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hardesty

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: So I have had this almost 2 years. Inhave had 0 issues with it. I used it last week to clean my wife's car, no problems at all. I go to use it this morning and as soon as i plug it into the outlet it starts making this crazy buzzing sound. I try several different outlets and still the same sound happens. I look it up online and it says I may have to replace the cord?!?!?! Ridiculous!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: karl

customer_reviews.title: Broke after roughly 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: Went to wash my mower today and after all the hookup, water was just gushing out of the bottom of the pressure washer. Took a better look, there was just metal pieces all shaking around in the bottom. Despite me prepping it for the season and draining the water out of it, the pump still broke. Garbage. Did enjoy smashing it against the sidewalk for 10 minutes. If Amazon could add Rage Smashability to the star points, I'd give it a solid 4 in that category.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hartman

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up following the simple instructions included
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an alternative to renting a gas powered pressure washer for some small jobs around my house such as powerwashing old paint off my deck and railing, getting some dirt and mildew off my siding, and cleaning my concrete walkway and porch. The unit works as advertised. It was easy to set up following the simple instructions included. It's a low weight, simple plastic construction. This washer was not built as a commercial grade, high end device, but for what it is intended for it fills a need and is everything promised.
customer_reviews.author: RGMurf74

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, quiet and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to power wash a backyard trellis, it worked surprisingly well. I didn't realize that any soap used must be pressure washer rated so I just used water only and ordered soap for the next projects. I was literally blown away at how well this washer removed the black grime and mildew on the white rafters. When done the trellis looks like it was just painted, very happy. It uses less water than a normal hose and really removes stuck on debris. I then washed all of the patio chairs and then the patio deck. My only regret is that I didn't get this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Rempalski

customer_reviews.title: The item arrived used with corroded / unsafe electrical
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and paid for a brand new unit. What I received definitely doesn't look new (see photos). Not only there are signs of wear & tear everywhere, but the electric plug also appears corroded and unsafe to use, along with traces of metal oxidation all over the unit. I'm very very dissapointed at both Greenworks and Amazon for such a complete lack of quality control. Waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: DMV

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Cleaning for an Electric Power Washer
customer_reviews.text: After an easy and quick setup I spent 30 minutes cleaning my 16' x 12' patio. It hadn't been cleaned since it was repainted three years ago. I used the turbo sprayer and it cut right through the dark discolorations down to the paint. The patio looks like new. This electric model cleans as well as the gas power washer it replaced. I didn't have any of the problems some people previously mentioned. At this time I'm very pleased with this purchase. Before ordering the GreenWorks 1951 I checked Consumer Reports online review. It's a CR Best Buy. I'll update this review in one month if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lentini

customer_reviews.title: Worked great the first time.  Won't work the 2nd.
customer_reviews.text: Worked just fine the first use, used it for maybe 30min. Now, a week later, it won't power up. I suspect the GFI/breaker thing built-into the power cord is the culprit, but it renders the whole thing useless. Have tried 3 different outlets (15 and 20amp), without any extension cord. On the chat with Amazon support at this time to try and send this thing back - clearly not any kind of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 9 mo; no customer support; waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This pressure washer was supposed to be a quality item, and from the beginning it has been a pain, and is now broken, 9 months into occasional use. The washer now will not automatically turn off pressure as needed. The pressure builds and builds and doesn’t let off. The cord is hard to wind, the water tube is a hassle, the attachments are very hard to get on and off. The worst part is that, as soon as I had the problem with the pressure staying on, customer service is nonexistent. I have called them and no one answers. I have emailed them three times with no response. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Little Bee

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Not a reliable brand. I’ve had two of these over 3 years. The first one was the 1500 version. It broke (hose fracture) during first season. Amazon took the return. A year later I replaced it with this version (1600). It was the cheapest power washer by $30. It lasted one season and then the O-rings and connectors to power hose eroded and it could no longer generate any pressure at the nozzle. Since I’ve had it for over a year I can’t return it. Two fails. Just bought a sun joe which was more money but more psi. We will see but I can’t recommend greenworks!
customer_reviews.author: CT Music

customer_reviews.title: BIG PUNCH FOR A PORTABLE POWER WASHER
customer_reviews.text: We moved into a new place where we rent and my son accidentally got oil on the driveway. We purchased this to help clean it up which it did a fantastic job, but we also found that it works very well for our cars, sidewalks, steps and all over power cleaning. It is very light weight and portable. I have even used it in my shower to power wash tile. Good product for the price and versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Cher E Reynoso

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken (pics)
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning it. Was leary of getting a used machine like a lot of the reviews say. But it looks new, seems like a quality product. Parts are sturdy. Power cord is GCFE, never seen anything like that before. Fairly heavy. A two handed lift to carry/store. Has wheels and a little back pocket. Not sure but the reservoir is small, maybe for a concentrated cleaner because mostly water will come through from the hose? Too bad I don't get a chance to use it. Not sure if I'll get this one again.
customer_reviews.author: SheTriedIt

customer_reviews.title: great size and power.
customer_reviews.text: We really like this one!!! Gone are the days when you need a 50lb, non portable or only on wheels power washer that is just a pain. This one is small, compact, and powerful. We love it!!! We have washed our cars, and started to power wash our patio. It is wonderful! It works really well, and makes quick work of most jobs! The only thing we can critique is plan on needing a better foam cannon should you plan on using it for cars, boats, etc. All in all great power washer that is easy and small to store and use!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy M

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little power washer for the price
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews stated this is a pretty good little washer for the price. I received a new / never used device. Assembly was pretty easy but instructions could be a little clearer. No leaking. Cleaning the sidewalk pretty well I’d say! So far so good and happy power washer here.
customer_reviews.author: WindyRocksIndy

customer_reviews.title: What POOWWWEEERRR!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG!! I was recommended this product by a friend at regular price and I got this during the “Deal of the Day” on Amazon and “What a DEAL!!”. This came ready to go out of the box. Easy to attach all the attachments. Easy to follow instructions, turned on the water, turned the switch on and POWER!! For a small machine, I was quite surprised and amazed of how much push. Bought this to wash my rig and it’s more than enough to handle a wash and everything else!! 1600 psi?? Feels more than double that...seriously! Saved some serious water when washing. All that spray but look at the ground. Hardly wet. Amazing product!!
customer_reviews.author: Ovid P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Price! Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This 1600 PSI Pressure Washer works great for as small as it is. I do wish Greenworks made this model with wheels like some previous models. It is rather a nuisance to keep picking it up and moving it. I found a issue with the plastic low pressure soap bottle that came with the Pressure Washer. The fitting is also plastic and does not fit properly or tightly. . It is pretty much useless! Greenworks does offer a buy-separately $28.00 detergent tank with metal fitting, which is probably what is needed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy pudding pie
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. I didn't use any detergent, just plain water and the green tip. My garage siding looks brand new. And it removed the sticky crawling vine residue that had been stuck to the house for years. Great little washer. Easy to assemble and easy to use. I recommend it for sure. It even cleaned my concrete patio and revealed bright orange and green rocks in the concrete that I never seen before. It took less than two hours to finish the whole back of my house, garage and concrete. Great buy. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Monica overton

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Works fine when water supply is steady. Unfortunately the connector where you attach the hose leaks badly. It is not from the connection but from where the port connects to the body of that washer. Positioning it just right and the leak is slow enough that the machine will run. But the slightest movement of the machine causes the leak to gush and the pressure drop. Glad I did not spend a lot on this. But still would have rather paid a little more and got something better. Not really a "bargain".
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyBo

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this, I was missing the spray wand and tried to contact the manufacturer as requested on the directions, when I didn't hear from them and it was getting close to the end of the return window I contacted Amazon and they helped me out. The pressure out of the spray bottle is lower than I'd like but with the nozzles it works very well. We have used it several times to clean cement, dogs pens, and siding. It plugs in but the cord is a good length and it stays standing up while in use and doesn't easily tip over.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Use it for the right job
customer_reviews.text: PRO: Compact. Good for siding, patios, railings and cars. CON: Not powerful enough for concrete driveway or sidewalks. Power plug is larger than usual because it has a GFCI plug built in. So, it won't fit into an outdoor outlet if your outlet is encapsulated in a weather proof box.
customer_reviews.author: Benny T. Chow

customer_reviews.title: Love my Pressure Washer!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so very happy with this pressure washer. It was a lightning deal and I had always wanted to try one since paying for someone to clean the driveway was expensive. I not only cleaned my porch, sidewalk, deck, I had some fun and wrote my daughter's names on the driveway before cleaning! Easy to assemble, easy to use, works great... was quite satisfying to see how well I could clean with it! I only wish I had purchased a stronger one... I purchased the 1600, I now wonder what the higher power washers can do. I’m amazed!! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: cboz

customer_reviews.title: Good pressure washer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once, but this sucker exceeded my expectations! I wasn't sure what to think about a small electric pressure washer, but I power washed the back of the house, and it blasted away years of dirt and grime from my gutters. It will be perfect for washing our cars too! I really didn't have a need for a high powered gas pressure washer, so this is perfect. Especially for the sale price that they had yesterday, (August 23. $69). Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for a such small unit!
customer_reviews.text: I've been toying with an idea to get a power washer for a while. Living in a single home is a challenge as far as maintenance goes, so finally I pulled a plug on this pressure washer. Fast forward I cleaned a walk way that was probably 10 years overdue. While this power washer may not be as powerful as some others, It got the job done just fine. Yes, it took longer, but the results were very satisfactory: just take a look at the picture. And the fact that it's small, light and easy to store is a big plus. No regrets whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Yelin

customer_reviews.title: For the money it's great, only one issue for me.
customer_reviews.text: I think it was designed to be light and portable, but my issue is that its too late. I am constantly pulling it over when washing my car. I just wish that it could hold its ground a little better. I always have to carry it around with me so it doesn't get knocked over. Other than that, the power is sufficient for my purpose and it stores very easily. Although it is light, it does seem like a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard N.

customer_reviews.title: its an okay power washer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this power washer for auto detailing purposes so far the only thing that has been bothering is the hose the power hose comes with it a very solid hose but when retracting but to the hose wheel it gets twisted and bent it almost feels like it wont last. On another not the hose storing unit on top of the power washer itself is a good design but since the power washer is so lightweight you tend to knock it over when retracting the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: great little washer, great price, great customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in November for Spring cleaning, used it first time this month (May) after 10 minutes it started cutting on & off. I contacted customer support they immediately replied they were escalating it to product support who would be in touch. Tried it the next day it worked perfectly. Apparently unbeknownst to me we were having water pressure problems the day before. Repeat: great little washer, great price, great customer support!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it. Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.text: Revived it, unboxed it and during assembly I had water run out of the hose. Which means I think I received a used item. Then when I took the plastic cover off the threads to attach the hose there was a white almost salt build up. Emailed greenworks. No response. Decided to try it anyways, after about 15 min of use I switched it off. Now it won’t come back on. The washer its self is hot. Overheated after 15 min. Don’t waste you’re money! Go gas!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great pressure washer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great pressure washer for the price, I use it mainly to wash my car and I think it works great. 4 stars and not 5 because I feel like the high pressure hose is a little too short and the soap reservoir does not shoot out the soap foamy like you would expect a pressure washer to do. I feel like there’s aftermarket parts that I can buy to get that foamy affect but I haven’t looked into it yet. Other than those two issues, I think this pressure washer is great.
customer_reviews.author: Juan N

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: PROS: It is light enough to pick up and move around. The power cord is long enough to cover some distance. Operation is simple. Pressure is good. CONS: It is electric, so there is a power cord always in the way, and you are tethered to an outlet. But, electric is what I chose and paid for, so I'm not complaining. The soap container does not lock into the quick connect, so it leaks pretty badly, unless I just don't know how to connect it properly. I am very happy with the decision to buy this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Fudge

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning concrete / pavers / patio
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and powerful enough to remove years of dirt and mold from our patio. Need to use it fairly close to the surface so be prepared for spending decent amount of time to cover a large area but for typical patio area - great device. Would have liked to see a longer electrical cord thus giving it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: E.G.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my first one that lasted a decent 7 months. Then it would not start. Ordered a new one and it would not work fresh out of the box. Amazon sent a replacement it did not start as well. Retuned it and bought the Stanley model for a bit more money and it is far superior to this piece of junk. Don’t waste you money and buy a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: MIkey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work the way it’s supposed to be :(
customer_reviews.text: I won’t recommend at all. The pressure is same as you get it from a regular tap. Doesn’t work to your expectation please don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Worked well.
customer_reviews.text: At first, the stream was very weak. It took a while before it really got to full force. When it did, it was pretty consistent and worked well. We had to use the narrowest jet (tip) in order to remove dirt from a screened porch. Sometimes I had to get the nozzle within inches of the painted wood to be effective. But it worked, and we were pleased with the result. The problem with a much more powerful machine is the risk of damaging what you are trying to clean — especially the grout on a brick sidewalk! So a little less power is safer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I'm down with Greenworks!
customer_reviews.text: I have converted many of my garden machines over to Greenworks (lawn mower, blower, trimmer, pole saw) and decided to give this pressure washer a go (purchased during Prime Day) and it did not disappointing! During un-boxing I noticed it was very light so thought it might not be very effective but once I read the instructions and got everything setup to test, I was pleasantly surprised how powerful it was! I have since used this unit to not only wash down my white PVC fence, I also complexly washed down my vinyl siding and all look brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Hot_pot_Junkie

customer_reviews.title: very nice power washer.  THIS IS THE ONE YOU WANT.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice power washer. Affordable, easy to use and hose and cord are very manageable. I like Greenworks, easy to use. The only one draw back is the Turbo nozzle is sold separately. The one I used from a friend had the Turbo nozzle and it works great. Just offered on this model.?? No complaints, Its use is great and makes you want to power wash everything in the yard.,driveway, patio, truly a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: brad smith

customer_reviews.title: What a little beast
customer_reviews.text: This little beast can even strip paint like it was nothing, when you pull the wand trigger it pushes your arm back and you can feel the power! No problems what so ever she is still purring along.
customer_reviews.author: xvp40

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty, I'm obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this powerwasher and am now the queen of powerwashing! Our backyard fence was looking old and weathered and this has made it new again! It's super easy to use and set up and while it's powerful enough to clean our wooden fence, it isn't so powerful that I feel like it's damaging it. Beware, if you order this- prepare to spend every weekend finding new stuff to clean. So far I've done our house, cars and fence..lol
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I own my auto detailing business and I wanted a pressure washer that was quiet but strong enough to get grime off easily. This machine does that well. As for the hoses connection position, it's a hot mess. However, I'm willing to put up with that because it gets the job done without waking up the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: 10Till8

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is bc you don't just "unroll and get going", the washer hose stores rolled up but unconnected on both ends. So, you have to in roll the entire hose, attach one en to washer and one to sprayer (obviously this is assuming water and electric are connected) before you can use. Then when you're thinking quick roll-up and done, wrong again. Now you have to detach both if those ends and then roll it up. I just don't see the convenience of having it roll up compared to my others that didn't. Other than that... it's great & gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Stacie R.

customer_reviews.title: Heck ya
customer_reviews.text: so I had wanted to get a pressure washer for home to do the cars - with Covid19 - I knew I wasn't going to be taking the cars to our regular car wash. Bought this - and just in the few weeks we have had this - I have already made my money back. The pressure is perfect for the cars - easy enough to work that even my 11yr old can get the job done. I did purchase a soap cannon which was a nice addition. Over all - very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do light power washing of a small patio and some other work around the house like cleaning vinyl fencing. I am very happy with the job this machine does. It will clean a concrete patio without a problem. I tested it on some vinyl siding and it did no damage. I was able to clean my vinyl fence in no time. I am very happy with this. I would not recommend this if you have a big job such as power washing an entire house.
customer_reviews.author: Bill_Collins

customer_reviews.title: Does not arrive as pictured or described
customer_reviews.text: I opened a customer support ticket with Greenworks on 5/26/2020 and received a case number. Now 6/15/2020 and have not received a response. The unit does not come with the Turbo nozzle as described above: "40 and Turbo quick connect nozzles and attachable detergent bottle to complete any job." The picture also shows the inline GFCI aproximately 8" from the plug. That allows you to plug into horizontal and vertical outlets. Mine arrived with the GFCI as part of the plug, so only can use vertical outlets. I'll update the review if/when I talk with customer service. For now....1 star
customer_reviews.author: Krusher

customer_reviews.title: Nice washer
customer_reviews.text: The washer cam in damaged. The handle was cracked completely through. It did not affect the function but did affect the movability. I had some heavy duty electrical tape and bound the handle. Looks OK, holds things together with out getting pinched or stabbed. I comes with 2 heads to put on the end of the wand, narrow and wide. This works for me. The power is good and I removed some ugly stains on the concrete and scale build up on my pool tiles. Saved me a lot of work. I deducted a star for the broken handle and the lack of response by reporting it
customer_reviews.author: Alfred A. Joreid

customer_reviews.title: Good little green machine
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 40 something wife and mom. I power washed my entire exterior house, driveway and lanai myself. It takes some time, but is a nice little machine. Wasn't too loud. Falls over if you yank on it. So don't yank on it. Goes through soap pretty quickly, but I don't know what to compare it to. Very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Malinda

customer_reviews.title: I got approximately 24 hours of use on decks, ...
customer_reviews.text: I got approximately 24 hours of use on decks, porches, some equipment, and floors over the first year. The unit started acting up during the summer but seemed to recover if I let it rest a while, so I overlooked it. The I noticed water running out from a leak behind the plastic cowling which I guessed might be a leaking hose or connector. Now that I finally took time to disassemble the unit, I discover the casting around one of the pistons is cracked open. So, the pump is ruined! I will contact the company for advice but I am not hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: bullet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for washing my vehicle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just to wash my car and it's doing an awesome job. it's just powerful enough to blow the dirt off and not worry about harming the paint. I'm using a foam cannon and special soap to suds the car up and then I put the 40° nozzle on to rinse off the vehicle, it works great. The hose is long enough to reach around both sides of the vehicle I don't have to move the pressure washer.
customer_reviews.author: R.Baratka

customer_reviews.title: Best feature I like about this is the convenience of ...
customer_reviews.text: Best feature I like about this is the convenience of the storage system and the surprisingly small size. The unit is lightweight and can tip over easily if you are pulling on the hose to unroll. Only reason why I don't love this is because I don't think it is as strong a Snap On that is rated 1700, possibly 1750, that I use from time to time for work. Will have to try the foam canon on the Snap On to see if there is a real difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sho

customer_reviews.title: Doing the job for me
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job, and made a lot more sense than renting multiple times for my different projects. I’ve had it a month and used it several times. It’s powerful enough for deck cleaning. It does a great job cleaning patio furniture and porch screens (be sure to stand back a ways for screens). I have more projects ahead. It’s not made super sturdy so I don’t know how long it will last, but I’ve already saved money with it. I recommend using quick connect fittings to put less stress on the machine’s connectors and save time.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie

customer_reviews.title: Pump broke after one season. Customer support sucks. Parts not available
customer_reviews.text: Worked well spring through fall 2019. Tried to use it March 2020 (one week after warranty expired), and water gushed from the inside, no pressure. Took apart and found the pump housing had cracked where the hose attaches, and I can't remove the hose. Send a support request via email on May 29; got the automated response, but no reply as of June 3. On hold now for telephone support for 36 minutes and counting.
customer_reviews.author: Doug D

customer_reviews.title: Plastic hose connection not strong.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great twice but the hose connection came loose on the third use and it leaks real bad. The connectivity to of the hose is not sturdy. For the cost I was not expecting a lot but had hoped it might hold up longer. Somewhat disappointed because I did expect better from Greenworks
customer_reviews.author: JTK

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: When I received this and took out of box, the handle was broke and my husband didn't want to spend any money to return it because he didn't know how long it would take to get a new one, so he duct taped it for now, we will be buying another one but will go elsewhere. As far as performance it did pretty good so was happy about that and we are just thinking they sent us one that had been returned already...Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Mary Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I covered these steps with "Wet and Forget" twice. After a couple of months I just couldn't forget it any more and decided to get a pressure washer. I have a small yard and very little concrete or pavement, but you can see what a dramatic difference 5 minutes makes! Those stains were not coming out with a regular hose, sunlight, or two spraying with a solution that was supposed to slowly eliminate it.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Carter

customer_reviews.title: A little confusing to assemble, but works great
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 45 minutes to figure out the instructions on how to put the spray on. Didn't explain that you had to push the tip down so that you can attach the piece. I found out by trial and error. Would have liked better instructions. Also, there the coils are super tight so make sure to unravel and stretch a little before using or else the machine will be falling a lot
customer_reviews.author: Nerdy Soul

customer_reviews.title: Not much power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a power washer with 1600 PSI. So this one should have been as strong or slightly stronger. I had to hold the tip within an inch or two of the surface being cleaned to get any results. This meant remaining bent over for the duration of the job. It was nicely designed and easy to put together, but I had to return it to get something with more power.
customer_reviews.author: God girl

customer_reviews.title: Died after second use in one year
customer_reviews.text: sat on my shelf for a year. Worked "ok" for the first few uses. then it stopped working. Internal short in the wiring. if i wiggle the wiring i can get the red light to come on on the cord, but it wont stay on. Waste of money junk! Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.author: hourang

customer_reviews.title: Power cable in picture is not what comes with the unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because none of the other units were capable of plugging into outdoor power outlet. The picture for this unit shows a power plug extension from the power reset switch. This setup is useful for plugging into an outdoor power outlet with a rain proctector on it. Blantant false advertising and the sellers should be held accountable.
customer_reviews.author: David Holt

customer_reviews.title: Worked once then never again
customer_reviews.text: Our Greenworks power washer worked great the first time. We power washed a patio one time and were very happy with the results. Fast forward two months later. It motor turned on briefly then shut down. We troubleshot with the manual and videos. Still nothing. We would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L2T

customer_reviews.title: Not what advertised
customer_reviews.text: Video showed wheels; even the Greenworks website showed wheels. When contacted, the rep was rude and would not help. Additionally, since wheels could be added, I tried to see if I could order them, at an additional cost. Nope, nothing on their site. I want to make sure that others really read and watch videos to make sure what they are getting. Thanks to Amazon, I can at least send this back. There are other units that are much better and have good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Rky Mtn Hi

customer_reviews.title: it's made of really soft plastic and leaks really bad all the time
customer_reviews.text: Pressure bled down after a few seconds holding the handle. Where you hook up the water hose to the pressure washer, it's made of really soft plastic and leaks really bad all the time. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Reider

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on one of Amazon's Christmas deal periods. I used it once and it cleaned my deck off very well. I smelled some pretty strong burning coming from the unit about 20 minutes in and stopped use immediately. Now I am trying to get some customer support. I will update my review when/if customer support is of any use.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Consumers was right, and you should buy this. :)
customer_reviews.text: I've had electric and gas power washers... ranging from 1500 PSI to 2300 PSI. This product absolutely beats them all. Great design, love the hose wrap, which solves a problem on every other unit I've owned! If I have any quibbles at all regarding this unit, it's simply this - the cup that holds the wand when stored tends to pop off at times. Not a major issue, just a minor annoyance. I wish they'd added some kind of power cord storage winder as well - but no big deal again. I wrap it around the handle for storage, and it's good to go. Gotta give this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Useful but not as good as gas.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to do some general cleaning of siding, decks, and walkways. I knew it probably wouldn’t be as good as a gas version but I was surprised how much less power it has. That said, I did get the deck pretty clean. The walkways are a lost cause with little or no visible result. The siding is better but still has some visible stains. On the good side, this uses very little water so it doesn’t cause issues with our well. Also, much quieter than a gas model.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: works great for 10 minutes....
customer_reviews.text: Constantly blows fuses and outlets. Tried this on my patio. Plugged it in and it worked great for ten minutes until I stopped. When I went to start again it would not power up. Found that it blew out the outlet. Plugged it into a heavy duty extension cord and a different plug and the same thing. Work for a minute and then blew out the extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: T. Horst

customer_reviews.title: Broken handle
customer_reviews.text: We were looking forward to using this product, as the majority of reviews were great. However I had an initial pressure washer and then a replacement sent to me, both of which had broken handles when the box was opened. We returned both items. Poor packaging or maybe a handle upgrade needed for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend, very good!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my pressure washer fir my car, fence and driveway. It does the work as expected; no problems at all. The quality of all the parts is very good; packaging arrived with no issues whatsoever. It’s small, easy to handle, ... is great! I have several Greenworks products, I’m very satisfied with all of them. Greenworks is an excellent brad. Mower, blower, trimmer, pressure washer... fantastic gym!!
customer_reviews.author: pacapo23

customer_reviews.title: Works...for a while
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product because a couple of friends recommended it. I received it in Sept of 2018 and used it 4 times before winter. Took it out to clean my car in April 2019 and after 5 minutes it stopped working. First it pulsed water pressure, but then the motor just stopped. When it did work it was good, but either I got a lemon or a rare malfunction occurred, but now I am outside the warranty and stuck with a void in a product I need for outdoor projects. Really disappointing,.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Nelson

product_meta.title: GreenWorks 1600 PSI 13 Amp 1.2 GPM Pressure Washer GPW1602
product_meta.description: Style:1600 PSIGreen works offers a wide range of pressure washer cleaning solutions to fit any homeowners needs. The 1600 PSI Pressure Washer features a powerful 13Amp Universal motor and all of the accessories you need to get the job done right.
feature_bullets: 1600 PSI at 1.2 GPM will blast through grime and dirt to restore your surfaces
Can be used vertically or horizontally for greater stability
20 feet High pressure hose for greater reach
35 ft. power cord with inline GFCI for use on all exterior outlets
Soap applicator to apply soap to completely clean any surface. Two nozzle tips and attachable detergent bottle to complete any job. Universal Motor:120,60Hz,13Amps

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,506 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
